title: Mary Lou ‘Mitzi’ and  Lawrence J. Meadows
content: , in Excelsior, Minn.      She was born Dec. 31 1929, in Chisholm, the daughter of John and Frances (Globokar) Ponikvar. Mary Lou enjoyed spending time at the lake with family and friends, traveling, cooking, doing anything in the garden, working outside in the sun and mostly loved having her grandchildren around and even holding “summer camp at Grandma’s for the kids.”      She was preceded in death by her sisters: Frances Nobens, Veda Ponikvar and Jenny Whiteacre; and her brother, John Ponikvar.      Lawrence J. Meadows, 86, passed away Tuesday, May 22, 2018, at N.C. Little Hospice, Edina, Minn.      Larry was born in Hibbing on Feb. 6, 1932, son of the late Fred and Mary (Marolt) Meadows. He was a graduate of Hibbing High School class of 1950. He proudly served in the United States Army during the Korean War. He and Mary Lou were married for 63 years. He was a pilot for 20 years and worked for the City of Hibbing for 15 years. A true outdoorsman, Larry enjoyed hunting, fishing and golfing in Canada and Minnesota with family and friends. He was an avid Vikings, Timberwolves, Twins, Wild and Lynx fan.      In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his brother Robert.      They will be dearly missed by their children: Mike (Lynn) Meadows of Chanhassen, Minn., LeeAnn Meadows of Eden Prairie, Minn., and Mark (Stephanie) Meadows, of Plymouth, Minn.; grandchildren: Mikaela, Sam, Zach, Mimi and Paige; relatives and many dear friends.      Thanks to the staff at Shorewood Landing and N. C. Little Hospice for taking care of Mom and Dad at the end of their lives.      Funeral: Services and a celebration of life for both Mitzi and Larry will be held at 11 a.m. Saturday, June 9, at the Blessed Sacrament Catholic Church in Hibbing.      Visitation: Relatives and friends are welcome to meet with the family from 9:30 to 10:45 a.m. Saturday at the Dougherty Funeral Home in Hibbing.      Burial: Will be in Maple Hill Cemetery in Hibbing.      Memorials: To N.C. Little Memorial Hospice, Inc., 7019 Lynmar Lane, Edina, MN 55435 are suggested in lieu of flowers or cards.      Arrangements are with the Dougherty Funeral Home of Hibbing. To leave an online message of condolence, please visit our website at www.doughertyofhibbing.com .
